snippet: Google executives are realizing that penalties for privacy breaches, like those it acknowledged involving its Street View project, do matter, if only because of the reputational risks.
abstract: News analysis; Google executives are realizing that penalties for privacy breaches, like those it acknowledged involving its Street View project, do matter, if only because of the reputational risks; however, it is difficult to make changes in an extremely successful technology firm.

byline.original: By DAVID STREITFELD and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
byline.contributor: Edward Wyatt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Google executives are realizing that penalties for privacy breaches, like those it acknowledged involving its Street View project, do matter, if only because of the reputational risks.

headline.seo: Google Focuses on Privacy After Street View Settlement
headline.main: Google Hastens to Show Its Concern for Privacy
headline.print_headline: Google Hastens to Show Its Concern for Privacy
